TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit FileFormatException extends System.FormatException implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
type FileFormatException = class inherit FormatException interface ISerializable

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when an input file or a data stream that is supposed to conform to a certain file format specification is malformed.
Creates a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor uses a default system message that describes the error, such as "An input file or a data stream does not conform to the expected file format specification." This message takes into account the current system culture.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A value that represents the error message.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a specified error message.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri sourceUri) cil managed

Docs.param: The value of the file that caused this error.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a source [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException> instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and includes the file name, such as "The file '`sourceUri`' does not conform to the expected file format specification." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class and initializes it with serialized data. This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException> instance with the specified error message represented by `message`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and includes the file name, such as "The file '`sourceUri`' does not conform to the expected file format specification." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.

Docs.param: The value of the file that caused this error.
A value that represents the error message.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a source [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] value and a specified error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException> instance with the specified error message represented by `message`. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance using the message parameter. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SourceUri As Uri
public: property Uri ^ SourceUri { Uri ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of a file that caused the .
Docs.value: A that represents the name the file that caused the exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If there was an error in obtaining the name the file that caused the exception, the return value is `null`, and SourceUri.<xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> returns an empty string.
